cons: The playscheme needs more staff. It's hard to be able to give enough children access to the playscheme if there aren't enough playworkers.

review_title: No care or support for staff
job_title: Senior Support Worker in Banbury, England
pros:
Team: support staff and service users are the only reasons this job is remotely viable. I really like and care about my team and have enjoyed supporting all the service users I have worked with. 
Flexible working contract.
cons: No sick pay for first 3 days of illness (for myself as part time, that is a weeks wages), so no support for staff when they are vulnerable and need it, management don't care about anything other than covering shifts, no pay increase or enhancements for the last 7 years (at least), no incentives, no team building, no tangible support and if you dare to speak up or challenge the inadequacies be prepared to be ostrascised and disliked. Poor communication. No career progression or opportunities to enhance or further careers. Low wages for a position with such a lot of responsibility.

pros: Supporting adults with learning disabilities.
cons: Can sometimes be very long hours

pros: The people we support are great, the support staff are great
cons:
Too many to write down I would probably lose my job if I did, 

if you don't mind management that offer zero support and just try to find fault or excuses then this is the company for you!

There is no empathy or compassion towards staff anymore this changed over the last year or two

pros: Good company to work for
cons: Could change shift patterns at times

pros: Very committed staff who do a great job
cons: Senior management distant and not decisive in their decision making.

job_title: Disability Support Worker in Bristol, England
pros: Some lovely caring friendly staff who I have had the privilege to work along side. Staff try hard to make a difference to the lives of the individuals they support. Lovely place to work.
cons: Poor management in head office they do not seem to know the homes or any of their staff team let alone the people they provide the service for.

review_title: More support needed for clients and service users
pros: Good staff team of dedicated staff
cons: Bad pay, lack of support from office management, bad treatment of long term staff

pros: Had some very happy and caring staff who are lovely to work with

pros: Its nice to make a difference to someone's life with Learning Disabilites

review_title: Good charity, lots of shifts available.

pros: stability, meaningful, I like helping people
cons: small salary, poor management, poor working hours

pros: The house I worked out was the absolute best, the people we supported were amazing and real characters. The staff team were the best, I felt secure and enjoyed every minute at my job there.
cons: The only thing was, there wasn't enough hours for me to stay! Or any room for progression, but at the same time it shows everyone is comfortable where they are!
